blocks.name: classify
blocks.description: This endpoint allows you to perform the classification of many text samples using only one request to a custom or public module.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: The api key obtained from Monkey Learn

args.name: classifierId
args.info: ID of the classifier. Example: cl_5icAVzKR

args.name: text
args.info: The text that you want to classify

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Set this parameter to true if you want to use the sandbox to perform the classification.

args.name: debug
args.info: Set this parameter to true if you want to use the debug output.y

blocks.name: classifyMulti
blocks.description: This endpoint allows you to perform the classification of many text samples using only one request to a custom or public module that you have already installed. In order for this endpoint to work, the module has to be set as a Multilabel Module.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: The api key obtained from Monkey Learn

args.name: classifierId
args.info: ID of the classifier

args.name: textList
args.info: Type: Array. List of the texts which you want to classify. Example: ['First text to classify','Second text to classify']

args.name: sandbox
args.info: Set this parameter to true if you want to use the sandbox to perform the classification.

args.name: debug
args.info: Set this parameter to true if you want to use the debug output.y

blocks.name: getClassifiers
blocks.description: This endpoint returns the classifier and it’s sandbox categories attributes.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: The api key obtained from Monkey Learn

blocks.name: getSingleClassifier
blocks.description: This endpoint returns the classifier and it’s sandbox categories attributes.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: The api key obtained from Monkey Learn

args.name: classifierId
args.info: ID of the classifier

blocks.name: createClassifierCategory
blocks.description: This endpoint creates a new category on the tree. You have to select a name and a parent category.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: The api key obtained from Monkey Learn

args.name: projectId
args.info: ID of the project

args.name: name
args.info: Category name

args.name: parentId
args.info: ID of parent category

blocks.name: updateClassifierCategory
blocks.description: This endpoint edits a category from the tree on a classifier.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: The api key obtained from Monkey Learn

args.name: projectId
args.info: ID of the project

args.name: categoryId
args.info: ID of category

args.name: name
args.info: Category name

args.name: parentId
args.info: ID of parent category

blocks.name: deleteClassifierCategory
blocks.description: This endpoint deletes a category from the tree. This action cannot be undone.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: The api key obtained from Monkey Learn

args.name: projectId
args.info: ID of the project

args.name: categoryId
args.info: Category id

args.name: samplesStrategy
args.info: Parameter can have 2 values: “move-to-parent” or “move-to”. If you select “move-to” then also have to set the “samples-category-id” paremeter with the id of the category where you want to move the samples.

args.name: samplesCategoryId
args.info: Category id

blocks.name: uploadSamplesToCategory
blocks.description: This endpoints allows you to upload samples to the categories.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: The api key obtained from Monkey Learn

args.name: projectId
args.info: ID of the project

args.name: samples
args.info: A list of dictionaries with the sample text (text property) and the ID of the category that sample should be saved (category_id property). The category IDs can be retrived using the classifier detail endpoint. Example: [{"text":"Example sample test 1 to category","category_id":17145562}]

blocks.name: uploadSamplesToMultiCategory
blocks.description: This endpoints allows you to upload samples to one or more categories.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: The api key obtained from Monkey Learn

args.name: projectId
args.info: ID of the project

args.name: samples
args.info: A list of dictionaries with the sample text (text property) and the ID of the category that sample should be saved (category_id property). The category IDs can be retrived using the classifier detail endpoint. Example: [{"text":"Example sample asdasdasdtest asdasd1 to category","category_id":[17145562]}]

blocks.name: trainClassifier
blocks.description: This endpoint allows you to train a classifier.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: The api key obtained from Monkey Learn

args.name: classifierId
args.info: ID of the classifier

blocks.name: deployClassifier
blocks.description: This endpoint allows you to deploy the current sandbox classifier as the live classifier. Note that the old live classifier will be overwritten.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: The api key obtained from Monkey Learn

args.name: classifierId
args.info: ID of the classifier

blocks.name: createClassifier
blocks.description: This endpoint creates a new classifier.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: The api key obtained from Monkey Learn

args.name: name
args.info: Classifier name

args.name: description
args.info: Classifier description

args.name: trainState
args.info: Train state. TRAINED or UNTRAINED

args.name: language
args.info: This setting should match the language in your samples. Default: en

args.name: ngramRange
args.info: N-gram range sets if features to be used to characterize texts will be Unigrams, Bigrams or Trigrams. Example: 1-1

args.name: useStemmer
args.info: This setting sets if words should be stemmed. The stemming process transforms words into their root form, so inflected and derived words are grouped together. Default: true

args.name: stopWords
args.info: Stopwords are words that usually do not contribute as classification features. Example: soft,it

args.name: maxFeatures
args.info: This sets the maximum number of features to be used to characterize texts in the training/classification process.

args.name: stripStopwords
args.info: Strip

args.name: isMultilabel
args.info: Define if the module is single-label (default) or multi-label. You can only set this option when you first create the module and you cannot change it later.

args.name: normalizeWeights
args.info: Weights normalize

args.name: classifier
args.info: Use this setting to choose which classification algorithm you want to use for this classifier.

blocks.name: deleteClassifier
blocks.description: This endpoint deletes a classifier. This action cannot be undone.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: The api key obtained from Monkey Learn

args.name: classifierId
args.info: ID of the classifier

blocks.name: extractKeywordsInEnglish
blocks.description: Extract keywords from a list of texts in English.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: The api key obtained from Monkey Learn

args.name: textList
args.info: Type: Array. A list of texts from which to extract keywords. Example: ["Monkeylearn is a Text Mining toolkit.", "This is a very good extractor"]

args.name: maxKeywords
args.info: The maximum amount of keywords to extract, defaults to 10.

args.name: useStemming
args.info: Take words to their base form in order to get better results , defaults to true.

args.name: useIdfs
args.info: Use a language model for computing the Inverse Document Frequencies, defaults to true.

args.name: lowercase
args.info: Lowercase all the given text, defaults to false.

args.name: useCompanyNames
args.info: Expand company names, if in the text appears the word ‘Google’ and in other part appears ‘Google Inc.’, the word ‘Google’ will be expanded to ‘Google Inc.’. Defaults to false.

args.name: expandAcronyms
args.info: Expand acronyms to they full form, for example ‘USA’ to ‘United States of America’ if both tokens appear in the given text. Defaults to false.

args.name: keepAmpersand
args.info: Keep the ‘&’ char when it appears inside a name. For example ‘Ferrara & Wolf’. Defaults to false.

blocks.name: extractKeywordsInSpanish
blocks.description: Extract keywords from a list of texts in Spanish.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: The api key obtained from Monkey Learn

args.name: textList
args.info: Type: Array. A list of texts from which to extract keywords.

args.name: maxKeywords
args.info: The maximum amount of keywords to extract, defaults to 10.

blocks.name: extractTextFromBinary
blocks.description: Extract plain text from binary documents as .doc, .docx, .pdf and .odt.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: The api key obtained from Monkey Learn

args.name: file
args.info: The binary file from which to extract the text.

blocks.name: extractTextFromHTML
blocks.description: Extract relevant text from a list of HTML’s. This algorithm can be used to detect and remove the surplus “clutter” (boilerplate, templates) around the main textual content of a web page.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: The api key obtained from Monkey Learn

args.name: html
args.info:
HTML from which to extract the texts. Example: '

New products and services are released every month that dramatically change how we can develop products and manage our IT shops. Innovation is everywhere; it can be hard to keep up, but that is part of the fun

'

blocks.name: extractEntities
blocks.description: Extract Entities from a list of texts using Named Entity Recognition (NER). NER labels sequences of words in a text which are the names of things, such as person and company names. This implementation labels 3 classes: PERSON, ORGANIZATION and LOCATION.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: The api key obtained from Monkey Learn

args.name: textList
args.info: Type: Array. A list of texts from which to extract the entities. Example: ["Juan lives in Uruguay.", "Monica lives in the USA."]

blocks.name: extractEntitiesInSpanish
blocks.description: Extract Entities from a list of texts in Spanish using Named Entity Recognition (NER). NER labels sequences of words in a text which are the names of things, such as person and company names. This implementation labels 4 classes: PERS, ORG, LUG and OTROS.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: The api key obtained from Monkey Learn

args.name: textList
args.info: Type: Array. A list of texts from which to extract the entities. Example: ["Juan vive en Uruguay.", "Monica vive en USA."]

blocks.name: executePipeline
blocks.description: Executes the selected pipeline.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: The api key obtained from Monkey Learn

args.name: pipelineId
args.info: A list of texts from which to extract the entities.

args.name: data
args.info: Depends on the pipeline definition. The JSON you post here will be used as the initial state of the Pipeline.
